title: The Hero Of The Western Isles
opening: Roy couldn't believe Larum's story.  He quickly penned off a letter to Cecilia
letting her know of the horrors happening on the Western Isles.  He also let
her know of the actions that he planned to take from now.
After sending the letter, Roy and company moved towards the mine in Mt Ebrakhm
to try and rescue the people suffering from forced labor.
Etruria had assigned Bishop Oro of the Elimine Church to supervise the mine.
Already a large amount of minerals had been taken, but it seemed that they
Ebrakhm...known now as the Mine of Death.  The wails of the people forced into
labor there echoed through the mines, like the howling of ghosts...

intro.speaker: Melady
intro.line: I see... So Princess Guinivere is nowhere on the Western Isles?

intro.speaker: Oro
intro.line: We searched all over these islands, and we sent spies in to Lycian League, but we could not find the princess anywhere, I'm sorry.

intro.speaker: Melady
intro.line: I understand. I suppose I will search elsewhere. Bishop Oro, I thank you for your cooperation with Bern.

intro.speaker: Oro
intro.line: I will pray that you will be able to meet Princess Guinivere soon.

intro.speaker: Melady
intro.line: Thank you.

intro.speaker: Etruria Soldier
intro.line: Bishop Oro, who was that?

intro.speaker: Oro
intro.line: A Dragon Knight from Bern. Her name is Melady. She was looking for Princess Guinivere, who is her mistress.

intro.speaker: Etruria Soldier
intro.line: Did you tell her where the princess is?

intro.speaker: Oro
intro.line: Of course not. Princess Guinivere is a valuable hostage. When Advisor Roartz heard the news that Cecilia was hiding with Guinivere in Aquleia, he was as excited as the time when he reported the assassination of Prince Myrddin had been successful.

intro.speaker: Etruria Soldier
intro.line: Bishop Oro! You mustn't say he was assassinated...

intro.speaker: Oro
intro.line: Oh, I must watch my tongue. Anyway, Guinivere has much value.

intro.speaker: Etruria Soldier
intro.line: I see...

intro.speaker: Oro
intro.line: And now, why did you come before me? Did you not have something to say?

intro.speaker: Etruria Soldier
intro.line: Yes, my lord. It is about the village where the resistance leader is hiding. We are now prepared to launch an attack on the village, so I came to report.

intro.speaker: Oro
intro.line: All right, well done. Then start your attack immediately, before we have any unwanted interruptions...

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: So the resistance hideout is in one of these villages here?

intro.speaker: Larum
intro.line: Yes. But it's possible the landlord's troops have attacked it already.

intro.speaker: Merlinus
intro.line: I must say, that Oro is a despicable man. A bishop should be preaching the words of God to help the people. But in fact he is torturing his people! That is far from forgivable.

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: We should probably wait for General Cecilia's reply, but...

intro.speaker: Lycia Solider
intro.line: Master Roy! Troops from the castle are attacking the villages!

intro.speaker: Merlinus
intro.line: What! Master Roy, should we attack?

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: I guess we can't wait for her reply then... But I want to help the people here. Even if it means that we'll be on bad terms with Etruria.

intro.speaker: Larum
intro.line: Roy..

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: Let's fight!! So we can be proud of our actions when we return to Lycia!

battle.speaker: Galle
battle.line: Melady, did you find out anything about Princess Guinevere?

battle.speaker: Melady
battle.line: No... It looks like she left the Lycia Alliance Army. Just when I thought I had found her...

battle.speaker: Galle
battle.line: Well, then it’s no use looking here, I suppose.

battle.speaker: Melady
battle.line: Galle...I’m sorry. My squad was the only one assigned to look for the princess because King Zephiel wanted to keep it in secrecy. I’m sorry that I got you into this mess...

battle.speaker: Galle
battle.line: You have enough to worry about already... Don’t fret over things like that.

battle.speaker: Melady
battle.line: But you’re one of the captains working directly under General Murdock...

battle.speaker: Galle
battle.line: Don’t worry about that, General Murdock has agreed to my helping you. Anyway, Princess Guinevere must still be on the mainland. I guess we can ask General Narshen for help.

battle.speaker: Melady
battle.line: ...You’re going to bow down to Narshen?

battle.speaker: Galle
battle.line: ? Of course. He’s one of the Three Dragon Lords, and he’s leading the divisions in Lycia and Etruria.

battle.speaker: Melady
battle.line: Galle, aren’t you...mad?

battle.speaker: Galle
battle.line: About what?

battle.speaker: Melady
battle.line: I mean... You’re the one who should be a Dragon Lord. ...But Narshen accused you of not being a native of Bern, and he snatched the position away. And you’re going to bow down to him and ask him for help?

battle.speaker: Galle
battle.line: Well, what he said was true. I wasn’t born in Bern.

battle.speaker: Melady
battle.line: But...

battle.speaker: Galle
battle.line: Melady, don’t worry. I’m happy with the position I have now. King Zephiel and General Murdock put trust in me, even though I’m not a native of Bern. What more could I ask?

battle.speaker: Melady
battle.line: Galle...

battle.speaker: Oro
battle.line: Hahaha... I’ve got an idea... Someone!

battle.speaker: Soldier
battle.line: Yes, Bishop Oro?

battle.speaker: Oro
battle.line: Tell the bandits that the villagers in chaos. I want them to ransack the villages and collect the valuables.

battle.speaker: Soldier
battle.line: Yes. But... Are you sure? If this becomes public...

battle.speaker: Oro
battle.line: You forget that I speak for God Himself. If anyone tries to accuse me, he would be accusing God. There is no one on this island who can prosecute me! Now hurry. It will be a chance wasted if the crisis in the villages settles down.

battle.speaker: Soldier
battle.line: Yes.

battle.speaker: Klein
battle.line: So that’s the Lycia Alliance Army...

battle.speaker: Thea
battle.line: They’re supposed to be fighting against the bandits...

battle.speaker: Klein
battle.line: I know. But Lord Arcard says that they are working with the bandits to attack innocent villagers. Why are they doing the opposite of what they were told...?

battle.speaker: Klein
battle.line: Thea, can you take your troops and attack from the north? I’ll start attacking from here.

battle.speaker: Thea
battle.line: Yes, General Klein.

battle.speaker: Klein
battle.line: Thea! Wait.

battle.speaker: Thea
battle.line: Yes?

battle.speaker: Klein
battle.line: I heard that you have some siblings.

battle.speaker: Thea
battle.line: Yes. I have two sisters, one older, one younger.

battle.speaker: Klein
battle.line: Are they both Pegasus Knights like you?

battle.speaker: Thea
battle.line: Yes. Why do you ask?

battle.speaker: Klein
battle.line: Well, you see, I have a younger sister myself...

battle.speaker: Thea
battle.line: You have a sister? She must be very beautiful.

battle.speaker: Klein
battle.line: Thank you. Yes, she is pretty. But I heard that she got tangled up in some, mess and I don’t know where she is now...

battle.speaker: Thea
battle.line: What? Oh my...

battle.speaker: Klein
battle.line: I’ve sent out some people to look for her, but they haven’t had any luck. If I weren’t on this mission, I would go search for her myself...

battle.speaker: Klein
battle.line: Thea, take care of yourself. For your family’s sake.

battle.speaker: Thea
battle.line: Yes, thank you.

battle.speaker: Klein
battle.line: All right, let’s go.

battle.speaker: Soldier
battle.line: Sir, are you sure?

battle.speaker: Klein
battle.line: About what?

battle.speaker: Soldier
battle.line: Lord Arcard said to leave the fighting to Ilia’s Pegasus Knights so that we Etrurians suffer the least casualties.

battle.speaker: Klein
battle.line: Don’t be ridiculous, they are our companions and trustworthy comrades. We will fight full-force to support them. Understood?

battle.speaker: Soldier
battle.line: Yes, General Klein.

battle.speaker: Klein
battle.line: ...Still, Lord Arcard’s story is strange... The Alliance Army just got here. Would they get tied in with the bandits so quickly...?

battle.speaker: Bandit
battle.line: So you’re sure we can raid the villages as much as we want?

battle.speaker: Soldier
battle.line: Yes. But in return...

battle.speaker: Bandit
battle.line: Yeah, yeah, we’re supposed to take half of the loot to the castle, right? That’s one hell of a bishop you guys got yourselves over there.

battle.speaker: Soldier
battle.line: Thank you for your cooperation.

battle.speaker: Bandit
battle.line: All right, boys! Loot the villages! Grab all the treasure!

battle.speaker: Soldier
battle.line: Master Roy, bandits are appearing from the mountains in the east.

battle.speaker: Roy
battle.line: They’re thinking of attacking the villages during the confusion... We have to stop them!

battle.speaker: Thea
battle.line: Are you ready? We’re moving southward!

battle.speaker: Soldier
battle.line: Captain... Are you sure we’ll be all right?

battle.speaker: Thea
battle.line: Why?

battle.speaker: Soldier
battle.line: Perhaps the Etrurian army means to use us up front as pawns...

battle.speaker: Thea
battle.line: Who says that?

battle.speaker: Soldier
battle.line: One of our group heard rumors like that in the Etrurian army.

battle.speaker: Thea
battle.line: If you take rumors seriously all the time, you won’t be able to do anything in battle.

battle.speaker: Soldier
battle.line: But...

battle.speaker: Thea
battle.line: Besides, even if that were true, General Klein wouldn’t approve of it.

battle.speaker: Soldier
battle.line: Do you think so?

battle.speaker: Thea
battle.line: General Klein’s not like that. I trust him.

battle.speaker: Soldier
battle.line: ...All right. Then we’ll trust him as well, for we trust you, Captain.

battle.speaker: Thea
battle.line: Thanks. All right, let’s go!

battle.speaker: Soldier
battle.line: Echidna! We have surrounded this entire area! We know you’re hiding in there! Drop your weapons come out at once!

battle.speaker: Soldier
battle.line: Are you Echidna, the leader of the rebel forces?

battle.speaker: Villager
battle.line: Miss Echidna, I’m sorry! They took my family hostage to make me talk...

battle.speaker: Echidna
battle.line: Don’t worry, I understand. Leave this to me. Hurry home to your family now.

battle.speaker: Villager
battle.line: I’m sorry...really.

battle.speaker: Soldier
battle.line: If you surrender peacefully, perhaps Bishop Oro will have mercy on you.

battle.speaker: Echidna
battle.line: Sorry, but I’m sorta the stubborn type.

battle.speaker: Soldier
battle.line: Do you resist? Then we have no choice. Kill her!

battle.speaker: Oro
battle.line: What is taking so long!? Are the rebel forces that much of a problem?

battle.speaker: Soldier
battle.line: It’s the Lycia Alliance Army! They’re helping the rebels!

battle.speaker: Oro
battle.line: What!? The Lycia Alliance would turn against Etruria!?

battle.speaker: Soldier
battle.line: We have just received a message from the capital at Djuto! It says... ‘The Lycia Alliance Army is responsible for the murder of Duke Nord, and is suspected of treachery against Etruria. They may be allied with the bandits. Capture them!'

battle.speaker: Oro
battle.line: So they killed Nord... It looks like they’ve come up with a good excuse to get rid of the Alliance Army. Hahaha... Allied with the bandits. eh? How ironic...

battle.speaker: Soldier
battle.line: Lord Arcard has also provided us with some reinforcements to help us defeat the Lycia Alliance Army. They should be arriving shortly.

battle.speaker: Oro
battle.line: How generous! He said to capture them, but he probably plans on killing them anyway. Let us do the job for him! Kill them all!

battle.speaker: Soldier
battle.line: Yes, Bishop Oro!

recruit-talk.speaker: Clarine
recruit-talk.line: Klein!

recruit-talk.speaker: Klein
recruit-talk.line: Clarine!? You were safe! Thank goodness...

recruit-talk.speaker: Clarine
recruit-talk.line: I’m sorry I left without telling you... But I wanted to see you so badly.

recruit-talk.speaker: Klein
recruit-talk.line: The things you would do... Well, you’re safe, and that’s what matters. And what brings you out here? Did you find someone trustworthy to hire?

recruit-talk.speaker: Clarine
recruit-talk.line: No, I joined the Lycia Alliance Army and have been fighting alongside them.

recruit-talk.speaker: Klein
recruit-talk.line: The Lycia Alliance Army!?

recruit-talk.speaker: Clarine
recruit-talk.line: Yes, my healing staves have been very useful!

recruit-talk.speaker: Klein
recruit-talk.line: ..I see. I thought your eyes looked...sharper.

recruit-talk.speaker: Clarine
recruit-talk.line: I’m now a lady, I am.

recruit-talk.speaker: Klein
recruit-talk.line: ...Let me ask you this. What kind of an individual is General Roy?

recruit-talk.speaker: Clarine
recruit-talk.line: Hmm... He lacks a little finesse for a noble... I especially think that he has to take care of his hair a little better...

recruit-talk.speaker: Klein
recruit-talk.line: ...Let me rephrase the question. Is General Roy working with the bandits and attacking the people living on these islands?

recruit-talk.speaker: Clarine
recruit-talk.line: No, of course not! We are here to defeat the bandits!

recruit-talk.speaker: Klein
recruit-talk.line: I see...

recruit-talk.speaker: Clarine
recruit-talk.line: The Etrurians here are all malicious and evil people...it is so embarrassing! Klein...are you working for them?

recruit-talk.speaker: Klein
recruit-talk.line: No. At least not any after I heard your story.

recruit-talk.speaker: Clarine
recruit-talk.line: What?

recruit-talk.speaker: Klein
recruit-talk.line: I was sent here to protect the villagers. To fulfill my mission, I will hereby join the Lycia Alliance Army.

recruit-talk.speaker: Clarine
recruit-talk.line: Klein!

recruit-talk.speaker: Klein
recruit-talk.line: Then let’s go, shall we? Will you introduce me to General Roy?

recruit-talk.speaker: Clarine
recruit-talk.line: Of course! I love you, Klein.

recruit-talk.speaker: Klein
recruit-talk.line: Thea!

recruit-talk.speaker: Thea
recruit-talk.line: General Klein! What is the matter?

recruit-talk.speaker: Klein
recruit-talk.line: I’ve made up my mind. We’re going to fight alongside General Roy in the Lycia Alliance Army.

recruit-talk.speaker: Thea
recruit-talk.line: Understood, sir. Then we will as well.

recruit-talk.speaker: Klein
recruit-talk.line: Aren’t you going to ask why?

recruit-talk.speaker: Thea
recruit-talk.line: We are mercenaries. We follow our employer’s every order. Besides...

recruit-talk.speaker: Klein
recruit-talk.line: Besides...?

recruit-talk.speaker: Thea
recruit-talk.line: I trust your judgment, General Klein.

recruit-talk.speaker: Klein
recruit-talk.line: Thank you, Thea.

recruit-talk.speaker: Larum
recruit-talk.line: Echidna!

recruit-talk.speaker: Echidna
recruit-talk.line: Larum? You were all right? Good... If something happened to you, I wouldn’t know what to say to Elffin.

recruit-talk.speaker: Larum
recruit-talk.line: I’m sorry... If I hadn’t been caught, I could have told you about this earlier...

recruit-talk.speaker: Echidna
recruit-talk.line: It’s okay. Don’t worry.

recruit-talk.speaker: Larum
recruit-talk.line: But...

recruit-talk.speaker: Echidna
recruit-talk.line: Don’t cry over spilled milk. That’s not like you. And besides, I’m all in one piece. So everything’s fine, right?

recruit-talk.speaker: Larum
recruit-talk.line: ...Yeah.

recruit-talk.speaker: Echidna
recruit-talk.line: So anyway, who’s the army attacking the castle right now?

recruit-talk.speaker: Larum
recruit-talk.line: Roy and the Lycia Alliance Army! They came here to defeat the bandits.

recruit-talk.speaker: Echidna
recruit-talk.line: Lycia, eh? They’ve sure come a long ways to get here... And does it look like they’ll help us out?

recruit-talk.speaker: Larum
recruit-talk.line: Yeah! They helped me, too.

recruit-talk.speaker: Echidna
recruit-talk.line: All right, then I guess I’ll join, too! That’s okay, isn’t it?

recruit-talk.speaker: Larum
recruit-talk.line: Really? That would be great! I’m sure Roy would be glad, too.

boss.speaker: Oro
boss.line: Challenging me...is the equivalent of challenging God Himself. Take your punishment from my hands!

boss.speaker: Elen
boss.line: You are...a priest, are you not?

boss.speaker: Oro
boss.line: What of it? Anything can go unpunished if done in the name of God! Convenient, is it not?

boss.speaker: Saul
boss.line: Well, we certainly have an evil bishop here, now, don’t we?

boss.speaker: Oro
boss.line: I am simply living life the way I see fit. Anything can go unpunished if done in the name of God. Convenient, is it not?

boss.speaker: Saul
boss.line: You disgrace God... You shall pay for that!

end.speaker: Merlinus
end.line: Master Roy, there is a young man here to see you. He says he is a member of the rebels...

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: I’ll see him. Let him pass.

end.speaker: Elffin
end.line: Are you Master Roy? Pleased to meet you, my name is Elffin. I am a member of the rebel forces here.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: I am Roy of the Lycia Alliance Army.

end.speaker: Elffin
end.line: You have my thanks for saving our village here.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: No, we simply did what we felt was right.

end.speaker: Elffin
end.line: But now you have rebelled against Etruria. Certainly you had thought of that before you took action?

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Of course. As I said, we did what we felt was right. Although what we did is a sign of rebellion against Etruria, if the truth about these islands is made public, they will understand. I have sent a letter to a trustworthy member of the Etrurian court. If she takes the appropriate measures, I think we can tip the tables in our favor.

end.speaker: Elffin
end.line: I would not be so sure of that...

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: What do you mean?

end.speaker: Elffin
end.line: Did you ever think it odd...that Etruria sent you, in particular, to get rid of the bandits?

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Yes... Of course we did.

end.speaker: Elffin
end.line: This is merely a theory... But I believe that the ones who requested your help are Advisor Roartz and Lord Arcard.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: ...How do you know that?

end.speaker: Elffin
end.line: Why did they have to get your army off the mainland? Could there be some some sort of problem if you stayed in Lycia?

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Oh... I never thought of it that way...

end.speaker: Elffin
end.line: There are rumors...that Roartz and Arcard are actually tied in with Bern.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: What!? Then Lycia would be in danger!

end.speaker: Merlinus
end.line: M-Master Roy!

end.speaker: Elffin
end.line: Your country could be peril. Are you sure you want to be wasting your time on a little island like this?

end.speaker: Merlinus
end.line: He’s right! If Bern wanted to get us away from Lycia so they could invade, then we must return at once...

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: ...I’m not going back.

end.speaker: Merlinus
end.line: What!? Why!?

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Right now, it’s very difficult to judge what information is true and what is false. The worst thing to do is is to simply jump to information presented in front of you. Sure, I’m worried about Lycia...but my father is there, and General Cecilia also promised to take care of our land. But our army is the only one stationed on these islands.

end.speaker: Merlinus
end.line: That’s true, but...

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: If we just leave without fully clearing out the bandits, then what we did so far would all be a lie...

end.speaker: Elffin
end.line: ...I see you are blessed with a wise leader.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: What?

end.speaker: Elffin
end.line: Master Roy, I am sorry that I tried you so.

end.speaker: Merlinus
end.line: Tried us? So what you said was a lie!?

end.speaker: Elffin
end.line: I have not lied. But, I did present the rumor in such a way that you would easily jump to it. But Master Roy kept his head. I feel that I would like to serve an individual like you. Master Roy, please count me among your ranks.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: ...I don’t like the idea that you were testing us, but if you’re willing to help, then we will welcome you.

end.speaker: Elffin
end.line: Then...

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Yes, please fight alongside us. Well, then, back to business. What can we do to help the people on these isles?

end.speaker: Elffin
end.line: We must go to Djuto. The Etrurian capital is there. We must crush it to fully liberate the people.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: All right. We’re going to Djuto! We will fight for the people living here, and to defeat our true enemy!

end.speaker: Man
end.line: Ah, are you General Roy?

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Yes.

end.speaker: Man
end.line: You saved our village. Please take this as a token of our gratitude.

end.speaker: Soldier
end.line: General Klein, we will stay here and restructure the area, as you directed us.

end.speaker: Klein
end.line: Good.

end.speaker: Soldier
end.line: We wish we could fight alongside you. Oh, and here, here is the arrow that you had us keep. I will give it back to you. Farewell, and good luck, General Klein.

end.speaker: Klein
end.line: Thank you.

end.speaker: Soldier
end.line: Captain! We will return to Ilia to make our report.

end.speaker: Thea
end.line: Thanks.

end.speaker: Soldier
end.line: Oh, and this... Your sister gave it to me before we left. Please be careful...

end.speaker: Thea
end.line: Thank you. You be careful too.
